plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: Oleander is an evergreen shrub widely cultivated in warm climates for its showy, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom profusely in late spring through fall and often sporadically into early winter in mild climates.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, Southern United States, and other warm regions
plants.funFact: Oleander is highly toxic if ingested but is commonly used in landscaping due to its drought tolerance and long blooming period.

plants.name: Rhododendron simsii
plants.description: This tropical azalea species blooms throughout the year in suitable climates, with flowers peaking in cooler months. It features trumpet-shaped flowers and glossy leaves, popular in gardens across Southeast Asia and subtropical regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round with peaks in cooler months including December
plants.location: Southeast Asia, tropical and subtropical gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Indian Azalea is often used in bonsai for its manageable growth and vibrant flowers.

plants.name: Clivia miniata
plants.description: Clivia is a shade-loving evergreen perennial native to South Africa that blooms in late autumn and early winter. It produces clusters of trumpet-shaped orange flowers that brighten up shaded garden areas.
plants.bloomingSeason: April to December (Southern Hemisphere late spring to early summer, extending into December)
plants.location: South Africa; cultivated worldwide in shaded gardens
plants.funFact: Clivia is named after Lady Charlotte Clive, an 18th-century English aristocrat who first cultivated the plant.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: Japanese Camellia is an evergreen shrub famous for its large, rose-like flowers that bloom from late autumn through winter. This species thrives in temperate climates and is a staple in East Asian gardens.
plants.location: East Asia (Japan, Korea, China), cultivated worldwide in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers have been appreciated in Japan for centuries and are often associated with the samurai culture.
